info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 25 at 5:32AM EDT until September 25 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...The following county, in northeast Kentucky, Lewis and the following county, in south central Ohio, Scioto.
* WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 532 AM EDT, radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Portsmouth, Wheelersburg, New Boston, Vanceburg, South Webster, Camp Dix, Rosemount, Franklin Furnace, Sciotodale, Rexton, Garrison, Saint Paul, Friendship, Tannery, Firebrick, West Portsmouth, Kinniconick, Sciotoville, Stricklett and Harris.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING
